page.title: 06RECREATION
page.content: {Delamere Street Nursery-WINSFORD. This garden nursery has been open for twenty five years. It employs seven people. Most of the plants sold are alpines. The nursery specialises in growing lewisia. Dwarf conifers are raised from cuttings. All plants are sold to the general public many of whom are local. Mr.Mitchell the proprietor travels round the country displaying his plants at shows and buying others. He advertises in Alpine Journals. During the winter of 1985 he intends to replace one of his greenhouses with a polythene tunnel. This new invention will improve growing conditions for his plants. Gardening is an important leisure time activity of the 1980's, as more people educate themselves through the media of television and books.
